verses.text_plain: And the Lord visited Sarah as he had said, and the Lord did unto Sarah as he had spoken.
verses.verse_html: 1And the Lord visited Sarah as he had said, and the Lord did unto Sarah as he had spoken.

verses.text_plain: For Sarah conceived, and bare Abraham a son in his old age, at the set time of which God had spoken to him.
verses.verse_html: 2For Sarah conceived, and bare Abraham a son in his old age, at the set time of which God had spoken to him.

verses.text_plain: And Abraham called the name of his son that was born unto him, whom Sarah bare to him, Isaac.
verses.verse_html: 3And Abraham called the name of his son that was born unto him, whom Sarah bare to him, Isaac.

verses.text_plain: And Abraham circumcised his son Isaac being eight days old, as God had commanded him.
verses.verse_html: 4And Abraham circumcised his son Isaac being eight days old, as God had commanded him.

verses.text_plain: And Abraham was an hundred years old, when his son Isaac was born unto him.
verses.verse_html: 5And Abraham was an hundred years old, when his son Isaac was born unto him.

verses.text_plain: And Sarah said, God hath made me to laugh, so that all that hear will laugh with me.
verses.verse_html: 6And Sarah said, God hath made me to laugh, so that all that hear will laugh with me.

verses.text_plain: And she said, Who would have said unto Abraham, that Sarah should have given children suck? for I have born him a son in his old age.
verses.verse_html: 7And she said, Who would have said unto Abraham, that Sarah should have given children suck? for I have born him a son in his old age.

verses.text_plain: And the child grew, and was weaned: and Abraham made a great feast the same day that Isaac was weaned.
verses.verse_html: 8And the child grew, and was weaned: and Abraham made a great feast the same day that Isaac was weaned.

verses.text_plain: And Sarah saw the son of Hagar the Egyptian, which she had born unto Abraham, mocking.
verses.verse_html: 9And Sarah saw the son of Hagar the Egyptian, which she had born unto Abraham, mocking.

verses.text_plain: Wherefore she said unto Abraham, Cast out this bondwoman and her son: for the son of this bondwoman shall not be heir with my son, even with Isaac.
verses.verse_html: 10Wherefore she said unto Abraham, Cast out this bondwoman and her son: for the son of this bondwoman shall not be heir with my son, even with Isaac.

verses.text_plain: And the thing was very grievous in Abrahams sight because of his son.
verses.verse_html: 11And the thing was very grievous in Abrahams sight because of his son.

verses.text_plain: And God said unto Abraham, Let it not be grievous in thy sight because of the lad, and because of thy bondwoman; in all that Sarah hath said unto thee, hearken unto her voice; for in Isaac shall thy seed be called.
verses.verse_html: 12And God said unto Abraham, Let it not be grievous in thy sight because of the lad, and because of thy bondwoman; in all that Sarah hath said unto thee, hearken unto her voice; for in Isaac shall thy seed be called.

verses.text_plain: And also of the son of the bondwoman will I make a nation, because he is thy seed.
verses.verse_html: 13And also of the son of the bondwoman will I make a nation, because he is thy seed.

verses.text_plain: And Abraham rose up early in the morning, and took bread, and a bottle of water, and gave it unto Hagar, putting it on her shoulder, and the child, and sent her away: and she departed, and wandered in the wilderness of Beersheba.
verses.verse_html: 14And Abraham rose up early in the morning, and took bread, and a bottle of water, and gave it unto Hagar, putting it on her shoulder, and the child, and sent her away: and she departed, and wandered in the wilderness of Beersheba.

verses.text_plain: And the water was spent in the bottle, and she cast the child under one of the shrubs.
verses.verse_html: 15And the water was spent in the bottle, and she cast the child under one of the shrubs.

verses.text_plain: And she went, and sat her down over against him a good way off, as it were a bowshot: for she said, Let me not see the death of the child. And she sat over against him, and lift up her voice, and wept.
verses.verse_html: 16And she went, and sat her down over against him a good way off, as it were a bowshot: for she said, Let me not see the death of the child. And she sat over against him, and lift up her voice, and wept.

verses.text_plain: And God heard the voice of the lad; and the angel of God called to Hagar out of heaven, and said unto her, What aileth thee, Hagar? fear not; for God hath heard the voice of the lad where he is.
verses.verse_html: 17And God heard the voice of the lad; and the angel of God called to Hagar out of heaven, and said unto her, What aileth thee, Hagar? fear not; for God hath heard the voice of the lad where he is.

tokens.text: unto her, What aileth thee, Hagar

verses.text_plain: Arise, lift up the lad, and hold him in thine hand; for I will make him a great nation.
verses.verse_html: 18Arise, lift up the lad, and hold him in thine hand; for I will make him a great nation.

verses.text_plain: And God opened her eyes, and she saw a well of water; and she went, and filled the bottle with water, and gave the lad drink.
verses.verse_html: 19And God opened her eyes, and she saw a well of water; and she went, and filled the bottle with water, and gave the lad drink.

verses.text_plain: And God was with the lad; and he grew, and dwelt in the wilderness, and became an archer.
verses.verse_html: 20And God was with the lad; and he grew, and dwelt in the wilderness, and became an archer.

verses.text_plain: And he dwelt in the wilderness of Paran: and his mother took him a wife out of the land of Egypt.
verses.verse_html: 21And he dwelt in the wilderness of Paran: and his mother took him a wife out of the land of Egypt.

verses.text_plain: And it came to pass at that time, that Abimelech and Phichol the chief captain of his host spake unto Abraham, saying, God is with thee in all that thou doest:
verses.verse_html: 22And it came to pass at that time, that Abimelech and Phichol the chief captain of his host spake unto Abraham, saying, God is with thee in all that thou doest:

tokens.text: And it came to pass at that time
with thee in all that thou doest

verses.text_plain: Now therefore swear unto me here by God that thou wilt not deal falsely with me, nor with my son, nor with my sons son: but according to the kindness that I have done unto thee, thou shalt do unto me, and to the land wherein thou hast sojourned.
verses.verse_html:
23Now therefore swear unto me here by God that thou wilt not deal falsely with me, nor with my son, nor with my sons son: but according to the kindness that I have done unto thee, thou shalt do unto me, and to the land wherein thou hast sojourned.
 that thou: Heb. if thou shalt lie unto me

tokens.text: that thou wilt not deal falsely
with me, nor with my son
unto me, and to the land

footnotes.body_text: that thou: Heb. if thou shalt lie unto me
footnotes.body_html: that thou: Heb. if thou shalt lie unto me

verses.text_plain: And Abraham said, I will swear.
verses.verse_html: 24And Abraham said, I will swear.

verses.text_plain: And Abraham reproved Abimelech because of a well of water, which Abimelechs servants had violently taken away.
verses.verse_html: 25And Abraham reproved Abimelech because of a well of water, which Abimelechs servants had violently taken away.

verses.text_plain: And Abimelech said, I wot not who hath done this thing: neither didst thou tell me, neither yet heard I of it, but to day.
verses.verse_html: 26And Abimelech said, I wot not who hath done this thing: neither didst thou tell me, neither yet heard I of it, but to day.

verses.text_plain: And Abraham took sheep and oxen, and gave them unto Abimelech; and both of them made a covenant.
verses.verse_html: 27And Abraham took sheep and oxen, and gave them unto Abimelech; and both of them made a covenant.

verses.text_plain: And Abraham set seven ewe lambs of the flock by themselves.
verses.verse_html: 28And Abraham set seven ewe lambs of the flock by themselves.

verses.text_plain: And Abimelech said unto Abraham, What mean these seven ewe lambs which thou hast set by themselves?
verses.verse_html: 29And Abimelech said unto Abraham, What mean these seven ewe lambs which thou hast set by themselves?

verses.text_plain: And he said, For these seven ewe lambs shalt thou take of my hand, that they may be a witness unto me, that I have digged this well.
verses.verse_html: 30And he said, For these seven ewe lambs shalt thou take of my hand, that they may be a witness unto me, that I have digged this well.

tokens.text: unto me, that I have digged

verses.text_plain: Wherefore he called that place Beersheba; because there they sware both of them.
verses.verse_html:
31Wherefore he called that place Beersheba; because there they sware both of them.
 Beersheba: that is, The well of the oath

footnotes.body_text: Beersheba: that is, The well of the oath
footnotes.body_html: Beersheba: that is, The well of the oath

verses.text_plain: Thus they made a covenant at Beersheba: then Abimelech rose up, and Phichol the chief captain of his host, and they returned into the land of the Philistines.
verses.verse_html: 32Thus they made a covenant at Beersheba: then Abimelech rose up, and Phichol the chief captain of his host, and they returned into the land of the Philistines.

verses.text_plain: And Abraham planted a grove in Beersheba, and called there on the name of the Lord, the everlasting God.
verses.verse_html:
33And Abraham planted a grove in Beersheba, and called there on the name of the Lord, the everlasting God.
 grove: or, tree

verses.text_plain: And Abraham sojourned in the Philistines land many days.
verses.verse_html: 34And Abraham sojourned in the Philistines land many days.
